Tools for Student Records Research

Source: R/midfieldr.R
midfieldr.Rd

A package for investigating a data sample from the MIDFIELD database. The data comprise student records from registrars at participating US universities, including demographic, term, course, and degree information for 97,640 undergraduate students from 1987 to 2016.

Source

Data provided by the MIDFIELD project: https://engineering.purdue.edu/MIDFIELD

Details

This package provides functions to access, manipulate, and graph student record data. To illustrate the workflow, we would use these functions in sequence to compute and display the "stickiness" metric:

  • cip_filter() to select programs from the CIP data

  • cip_label() to add custom program labels for grouping

  • gather_ever() to gather students ever enrolled

  • gather_grad() to gather graduating students

  • race_sex_join() to join student sex and race

  • seplyr::group_summarize() to count students

  • dplyr::join() and mutate() to compute stickiness

  • multiway_order() to prepare the results for graphing

  • ggplot2::ggplot() to graph the metric

To learn about these and other functions in detail, start with the vignettes: browseVignettes(package = "midfieldr").

Data

Instructional program data is provided in cip, a data frame of names and codes of academic programs from the 2010 IPEDS Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) by the US Department of Education.

Student record data is provided in the companion data package, midfielddata. Data are provided in four datasets: midfieldcourses, midfielddegrees, midfieldstudents, and midfieldterms.

Contents

Developed by Richard Layton, Russell Long, Matthew Ohland, US National Science Foundation.
